p: An asymmetric fibre MZI consisting of a fibre taper and a lateral-shifted junction ( Figure 27) was shown to allow the simultaneous measurement of axial strain and temperature in [ 156]. The interferometer exhibited different environmental sensitivities for different device architectures. If the taper and the lateral-shifted junction (P+J in Figure 27a,b) were located in close proximity (<15 mm), then the device exhibited temperature sensitivities of 60.4 and 63.9 pm/°C (red shift) and axial strain sensitivities of –1.47 and –2.71 pm/με (blue shift) for the higher and lower interference orders m 1 (49) and m 2 (48), respectively ( Figure 27c). The junction–taper interferometer (J+P in Figure 27a) has temperature sensitivities of 60.1 and 63.3 pm/°C (red shifts) and axial strain sensitivities of −1.51 and −2.75 pm/με (blue shifts) for the interference orders m 1 and m 2, respectively.
